member.name: T:MicroServer.Net.Http.Modules.IWorkerModule
member.summary: A HTTP module which do something useful with the request.

member.name: T:MicroServer.Net.Http.Modules.IHttpModule
member.summary: A http module
member.remarks:
Each method will be invoked in all methods before continuing. i.e. the BegingRequest method will be invoked in all modules before the next method is invoked (which typically is RouteRequest).
Abort means only that the current method will be aborted for the modules. (EndRequest will still be invoked if you trigger abort in any of the methods

member.name: M:MicroServer.Net.Http.Modules.IHttpModule.BeginRequest(MicroServer.Net.Http.IHttpContext)
member.summary: Invoked before anything else
member.remarks:
The first method that is exeucted in the pipeline. Try to avoid throwing exceptions if you can. Let all modules have a chance to handle this method. You may break the processing in any other method than the Begin/EndRequest methods.
If you are going to handle the request, implement and do it in the method.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Net.Http.Modules.IHttpModule.EndRequest(MicroServer.Net.Http.IHttpContext)
member.summary: End request is typically used for post processing. The response should already contain everything required.
member.remarks: The last method that is executed in the pipeline. Try to avoid throwing exceptions if you can. Let all modules have a chance to handle this method. You may break the processing in any other method than the Begin/EndRequest methods.

member.name: M:MicroServer.Net.Http.Modules.IWorkerModule.HandleRequestAsync(MicroServer.Net.Http.IHttpContext,MicroServer.Net.Http.AsyncModuleHandler)
member.summary: Handle the request.
member.param: Invoked when the module has completed.
member.remarks: Invoked in turn for all modules unless you return .

member.name: T:MicroServer.Net.Http.Files.FileContext
member.summary: Context used by when locating files.
member.remarks:
There are three scenarios for files:
Not found Simply do not change the context, just return from the method.
Found but not modified. The file UTC date/time is less or equal to . Use and return
Found and newer The file UTC date/time is newer than . Use and return.

If you are going to handle the request, implement and do it in the method.

member.remarks: The default implementation constructor uses and

member.name: T:MicroServer.Net.Http.Serializers.IMessageSerializer
member.summary: Serialize or deserialize messages.

remarks.para: A suggestions is that you use the Type.AssemblyQualifiedName as the content name of your application is .NET only.
The methods must be isolated (i.e. should be able to call the same instance them from several threads).

The content type should follow the format defined by the HTTP specification (RFC2616) where the media type can be followed by a semicolon and then commaseparated key-value pairs. However, we might want to include the .NET type in the message which contains a colon between the FullName and the Assembly. In the content type we therefore need to replace it with a hypen. See example below
That allows us to support media types which are used by HTTP and other protocols where other parameters are included, for example:
You can use if you want to extract the actual content type and it's parameters.
